Yeah I've definitely put the classpath in the TestRunner class and 
I've added my project to the workspace classpath in VisualAge...

but I think it must be a classpath issue, as if I run JUnit from the 
tools menu in Visual Age it cannot find any of my classes.




--- In junit@y..., Mark Meyers <markm@m...> wrote:
> Check if you start JUnit with the searchpath for "myclass" in it's
> classpath...
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: messy_head_2001@y... [mailto:messy_head_2001@y...]
> Sent: woensdag 22 augustus 2001 15:47
> To: junit@y...
> Subject: [junit] ClassNotFoundException
> 
> 
> I am trying to use JUnit to test a method which calls
> 
> Class.forName("myClassName")
> 
> however I get a ClassNotFoundException from this line of code, 
which 
> works perfectly when not using JUnit. 
> 
> Any ideas??
> 
> David.
>
